page.title: 16Education
page.content:
Two classes of upper juniors are in a room which was purpose- built for team teaching in the late 1960's. It is two classrooms with a dividing screen across the centre which has never been closed. The third class is in a room next door.
The 9 to 11 year olds work together, and in the morning they are streamed into three ability groups. In the afternoon they work on environmental studies in unstreamed class groups.
The environmental studies for this age are more complex, with greater depth of research, and the use of secondary resources such as town council and parish records.
